comments:
20021029
We have sporadic errors in the test cases when Java elements are deleted. (see 
exception below). We suspect that the indexer interferes with the delete. 
e.g.
newCU.delete(true, null);
or
jproject.delete(...)

we fix it by changing to
JavaProjectHelper.performDummySearch();
newCU.delete(true, null);

The waiting for the indexer to stop should be added to IJavaElement.delete

org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaModelException[966]: 
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Problems encountered 
while deleting resources.
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.delete(Resource.java:457)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaModelOperation.deleteResource
(JavaModelOperation.java:280)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeleteResourceElementsOperation.processElement
(DeleteResourceElementsOperation.java:104)

(MultiOperation.java:160)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.MultiOperation.executeOperation
(MultiOperation.java:90)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaModelOperation.execute
(JavaModelOperation.java:321)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaModelOperation.run
(JavaModelOperation.java:621)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1378)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaElement.runOperation(JavaElement.java:562)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaModel.delete(JavaModel.java:94)

(CompilationUnit.java:183)
at

t(UnresolvedTypesQuickFixTest.java:261)

at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:1402)

(InternalBootLoader.java:831)
at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:462)
at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:247)
at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:703)
at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:539)

This should not be new anyway. The wait would only occur until the current job 
is finished, only if the it affects the deleted file... 

Not for 2.1 anyway.

The resource model doesn't provide any better solution. Maybe will be improved 
in future story with background processing support.

Moving to platform for further comment.

We don't plan to add support in platform for preempting readers on delete. If
another process is reading the file, then deletion will fail unless the OS
supports concurrent reading and deleting.
